Pour the bleach solution into the bird bath so that the entire surface of the tub is covered. Be especially sure to cover any areas of mildew growth or algae. Then let the solution set for 10 to 15 minutes. *It’s crucial that you cover the bird bath during this step so that no birds attempt to sit in it

Removing Algae. Drain the birdbath of any water. Make a paste by mixing baking soda and water in a bowl. Use a crumpled up plastic bag and scrub the paste into the algae stained areas. Continue to scrub, adding more paste as needed until all of the algae is gone. Rinse the birdbath with clean water.

The first step in cleaning a very dirty bird bath is to get rid of the contaminated water. This water is often filled with organic material such as feces, algae and dirt, and it is safe to use to water nearby flowers or plants.
